abstract: Far-right politician Geert Wilders is convicted of inciting discrimination and breaking Dutch law with comment that Netherlands would be safer with fewer Moroccans; panel votes not to convict Wilders of inciting hatred and it imposed no punishment; trial appears to have improved standing of Wilders and his Party for Freedom, and may improve his chances of becoming prime minister in 2017.

keywords.value: People's Party for Freedom and Democracy (Netherlands)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Mr. Wilders, who is seen as a likely contender to become prime minister after elections next year, has said that the Netherlands would be safer with fewer Moroccans.
snippet: Mr. Wilders, who is seen as a likely contender to become prime minister after elections next year, has said that the Netherlands would be safer with fewer Moroccans....

headline.main: Geert Wilders, Dutch Far-Right Leader, Is Convicted of Inciting Discrimination
headline.print_headline: Dutch Politician Is Convicted of Inciting Discrimination, but Not Punished
